covidlens 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Literature

Source: R/literature.R
literature.Rd

Scientific Literature for Covid-19 from the Lens database.

literature

Format

A data table with 32 variables and 66,233 rows.

lens_id

Lens database identifier

title

Publication title

date_published

Publication date

publication_year

Year of Publication

publication_type

Type of publication, journal article etc.

source_title

Journal, series or book title

issn

International Standard Serial Number

publisher

Publisher

source_country

Country, source of publication

authors

Authors, concatenated with ";;"

abstract

Abstract

volume

Publication Volume Numbers

issue_number

Publication issue number

start_page

paper start page

end_page

paper end page

fields_of_study

Microsoft Academic Graph fields of study labels

keywords

Author keywords

mesh_terms

Medical Subject Headings (MeSH)

chemicals

Chemicals in publication

funding

Funding body

source_urls

One or more hyperlinks to the publication source, concatenated ";;"

external_url

external urls, may be concatenated

pmid

PubMed document identifier

doi

Digital Object Identifier

microsoft_academic_id

Microsoft Academic Graph ID, may be concatenated

pmcid

PubMed Central ID

patent_citation_count

Count of citations by patent documents

references

Lens Ids for bibliographic references

scholarly_citation_count

count of scientific citations

source

Lens file source

dataset

Lens COVID dataset, short name

data_type

type of data, literature, patent or patent sequence

Source

Lens Covid-19 Scholarly datasets. Created by Osmat Jefferson. For further details see https://about.lens.org/covid-19/

Contents

Developed by Paul Oldham.
